tennis_two
Class SerialContest

java.lang.Object
  tennis_two.AbstractContest
      tennis_two.SerialContest
All Implemented Interfaces:
Contest
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdvantageMatch, AdvantageSet, SinglesGame, TieBreakGame, TieBreakMatch, TieBreakSet
public abstract class SerialContest
extends AbstractContest

A two-player contest played as a sequence of sub-contests. A serial contest is over when one player reaches the target score, with a specified advantage over the other player. For most types of contest, this advantage should be set to 1 or 2. Subclasses should define the actual sub-contest type. To specify use the SerialContest constructor

play

public void play()
Called on a Contest instance (could be a Match, Set or Game or Point). Then continues to play the associated Sub-Contests until this particular contest instance has a winner. Upon obtaining a winner finish() prints winner and contest information.

Specified by:
play in interface Contest
Specified by:
play in class AbstractContest
